page.title: 06HOME LIFE NEAR SANDHEAD
page.content: by Catherine Wright aged 11 The homes of many of the children who attend Sandhead School are a long way away from any other house. At home most children help their mothers and fathers with the work around the farm, garden, or house; doing such small jobs as feeding calves, pigs or hens, or cutting lawns, weeding flower beds or watering plants, or stacking wood, Hoovering, or baking. Sometimes at night we watch television - when we haven't got homework that is. Most of the secondary pupils at Stranraer Academy DO HAVE homework! Sometimes, when we go to bed, we decide that we are not tired and so we switch on the light and read until we are tired. In the morning, when we get up, we often find that Mum is already downstairs and has dusted the rooms and set the table for our breakfast.
